description: The Plato scale is a measurement of the density of liquid. The number tells brewers how big or small a resulting beer will be—the larger the number the bigger the beer. We designed 11.5° Plato—a lower number on the beer scale—to give us just enough body to support a heavy heap of hops. The result is an easy-drinking session IPA which satisfies the thirst for hops, but urges you to have another round.
name: 11.5° PLATO

description: This session IPA is an American Style Pale Ale, Copper in color, mildly malty and packed with citrusy American Cascade hop flavor and aroma.
name: 2 Brothers Session IPA

description: In a bold collaboration with Mother Nature, we grow our own varieties of aroma hops at Rogue Farms in Independence, OR. We also string, stake, train, test, trim, separate, sort, kiln and cool them. Brewmaster John Maier meticulously selected and blended 4 varieties of our aroma hops to create the approachable and aromatic signature of our 4 Hop IPA.
name: 4 Hop IPA

description: This spring seasonal is a hoppy ray of sunshine and is fraction of strength of our Hill City IPA.
name: 4/7 IPA

description: A crisp and refreshing spring wunderbeer, 77 Select is made with 7 choice ingredients and Fire Brewed in the pits of Fremont Brewing to achieve its rarefied Session IPA status. With this brew we respect Seattle's old Horlucks & Sicks Brewing Companies, predecessors of Rainier Brewing, and their flagship beers 66 Select and Rainier. "Alcohol may not solve your provlems, but neither will water or milk." -VWP
name: 77 Fremont Select

description: A sessionable beer for hopheads and commoners alike.  The lemon citrusy hop profile is noticeable but pleasant, thanks to loads of whirlpool and dry hop additions.
name: A Little Hoppy

description: Walk up to the bar and what do you ask for? A Beer, naturally. It doesn't always matter what it is, or what you want in this case. You want something light? We've got A Beer for you. You want something hop forward? We've got A Beer for you. You just want to camp out on that bar stool and crush something? We've got ABeer for you. We're only marginally apologetic that it's not kettle soured with Mosaic & Amarillo hops. This is better. This is a straight forward, refreshing extra pale ale utilizing the newest varieties of German aroma hops (Hallertau Blanc & Mandarina Bavaria). Call it a session IPA if you need, call it a pale ale if you prefer, hell, it doesn't matter what you call it, what matters is that you stop talking about it and throw ABeer down yer gullet.
name: Abeer

description: A light bodied Saison with bright hops.  Featuring Citra, Cascade and Nelson Sauvin.  Dry.
name: Adversity IPA

description: A modest, but flavorful malt selection is accented by American Citra hops and a new hop from Australia named Summer. This low alcohol IPA is bursting with exotic fruit flavors and aromas.
name: Afternoon Delight

description: The beer you've been waiting for. Keeps your taste satisfied while keeping your senses sharp. An all-day IPA naturally brewed with a complex array of malts, grains and hops. Balanced for optimal aromatic and a clean finish. The perfect reward for an honest day's work and the ultimate companion to celebrate life's simple pleasures.
name: All Day IPA

description: That’s why American Outlaw Session IPA is perfect for someone who needs to get things done, but aims to enjoy the taste of a good, flavorful beer at the same time. Our Simcoe-hopped session IPA pours a glistening, pale golden color and boasts a refreshing, citrusy flavor with a clean finish.
name: American Outlaw Session IPA

description: Bursting with hop flavor and aroma. A collaboration with the Indiana Forest Alliance.
name: Back Country Session IPA

description: A big punch of tropical hop character belies this IPA's sessionability.
name: Batch #100: Session IPA

description: Huge mango, orange peel, and citrus aroma with a firm bitterness backed with a very light malt backbone. Left unfiltered to preserve the bright hop flavor.  Our first batch, delicious and easy drinking!
name: Batch One Session IPA

description: Boat Beer is designed to be complex enough to merit drinking a few without being crippled by alcohol. Kolsch yeast and German malts are combined to be crisp and refreshing, while a generous amount of American hops have been added to keep it remarkable. Expect it to dance out of the glass with a whack of grapefruit and open into a crisp, stony tangle of white and yellow fruit with pine and moss notes. An IPA for everyday drinking, drink boat beer when you are thirsty from softball, fishing, or explaining why your team is best.
name: Boat Beer

description: Burnished gold in color, light to medium in body with an intense hop character that comes exclusively from kettle and dry hopping with Bravo hops.
name: Bravo Four Point

description: Fermentée 100% avec la Brettanomyces, cette bière met l’accent sur le côté fruité de la fermentation et non le funky de la levure. Elle vous donnera votre dose de houblon, en vous modérant sur l’alcool.
name: Brett Session IPA

description: She’s blonde and refreshing! She’s mighty mighty! Brewed with perfect proportions of Northwest hops and malts for a beer that makes an old man wish for younger days. This session ale lets it all hang out with easy drinkability and a light malt finish. …what a winning hand!
name: Brick House Blonde

description:
Easy drinking, loads of tropical hop flavor and a subtle tart finish.

We brew this session IPA with two of our favorite hops (think mango, guava and passion fruit) and add red wheat malt to give it a crisp, tart finish.  This is the beer we choose for Sunday Funday.
name: Bronx Session IPA

description: Brooklyn Scorcher IPA is a surprisingly sessionable IPA. A floral, piney aroma strikes first, followed by a burst of mouthwatering bitterness as the hops begin their attack. Suddenly, a hint of toasty malt and a clean, lively finish burst in to leave you thirsty for more. It’s ludicrously tasty, and at a reasonable 4.5%, it’s a beer you can come back to again and again. Try it with spicy foods, salads, grilled meats, cheddar, feta or just another Scorcher IPA.
name: Brooklyn Scorcher IPA

description: We loaded this session IPA with citrus and fruit forward hops, kept the body strong enough to stand to up to the barrage of hops, and dry hopped the heck out of it to make a session IPA we feel is worth stepping back and taking five.
name: Cape May Take Five

description:
This easy drinking IPA packs a hoppy punch without the bitterness. Casual is a light bodied ale featuring citrus and tropical hop flavors thanks to copious additions of five different hops during the dry hop process. this beer
is ideal for any time of year when you want to kick back and sip on a few beers.
name: Casual

description: Single malt and single hop OC Rockford exclusive. Great western pale malt and centennial hops. "Extra Innings" mini tour 2015.
name: Chicago S.M.A.S.H

description: Aggressively dry hopped with Citra, Nelson Sauvin and Pacific Jade to give this beer plenty of hop aroma without added bitterness.
name: Child Labor

description: The lights dim. Anticipation builds. It dawns on you: Nothing save a measly layer of aluminum stands between your tastebuds and one entire pint of Citra, El Dorado, and Amarillo hop essence. What could possibly be better than this moment? Actually drinking the beer.
name: Citra Fest

description: A tasty cask conditioned Pale Ale brewed with dill, celery, lemon, apple, and citrusy Cascade hops.
name: Citra Saurus

description: Despite his bitterness, lack of power and insuperable aversion to any kind of extravagant labor - he kind of has a charming charisma, and perhaps he is even loveable. Somehow we find him unbelievable irresistible and stimulating because he is one of the few that masters the ability to effortlessly impress with his sharp intelligence and make it look so damn easy.
name: Citra Sunshine Slacker

description: Light, clean, hoppy, and refreshing. Our sessionable IPA will lure you in with an incredible citrus, floral, piney aroma while the delicate malt profile dances briefly on the palate before moving to a dry, bitter, grapefruit ending. Not too hoppy, not too malty.
name: Colorado Greenback

description: Cosmic Truth Session Ale marries the thirst-quenching taste of a traditional Kolsch with bold, tropical Mosaic hops. Its crisp and refreshing body are brought to life with a punch of fruity flavor and subtle bitterness from the hop for a truly well-rounded experience.
name: Cosmic Truth Session Ale

description: More Session than IPA, this strawberry-blonde ale balances the bold citrus and herbal flavors of American hops with a hint of light caramel malt for a refreshing finish that won’t leave you with that embarrassing bitter beer face!
name: Cottonmouth Killer

description:
The wildcard in our line-up: Crushable IPA is our sub 4%abv session IPA.  The hops will change occasionally, and we may even ferment it with different yeast sometimes, but the core values will always remain the same.  Light, dry, crushable, yet full flavored and complex.  

Batch 1- House ale yeast, Citra and El Dorado hops 3.6%

Batch 2-Brettanomyces Claussenii, Simcoe hops 3.8%

Batch 3-House ale yeast, Simcoe hops 3.6%

Batch 4- House ale yeast, El Dorado and Azacca hops 3.6%
name: Crushable IPA

description: Session IPA
name: Day Drinker

description: Cucumber and basil
name: Day Spa Session IPA

description:
A Fractional IPA. 
Sometimes you want a beer, then you realize how much crap you need to do before you call it a day. This is it. Nicely dosed with Big, Round Hop Flavors and a Toasty Malt Foundation to satisfy your every need. But it still lets you stay in the game to do what needs to be done. Yup.
name: DayTime Ale

description: After a long day of work, its time to Decompress. Have a pint of Decompression Session IPA and let the day melt away. This Session IPA is 4.5 ABV, with a subtle citrus nose. Each sip brings out the citrus and tropical fruit flavors. Cheers!
name: Decompression Session

description: A session-style IPA with a blend of bittering and aroma hops designed to excite, not overwhelm the palate. Columbus provides the background bitterness while a unique blend of Amarillo, Centennial and Tettnanger hops add subtle, but distinctive flavor notes which harmonize nicely with the flavors of the various roasted malts. The beers moderate alcohol level allows you to drink this malt beverage for hours while enjoying your favorite activities & food.
name: DIRTY * ROTTEN * BASTARD * I.P.A.

description:
Down to Earth is the natural evolution (pun intended) of Bitter American, our original session ale. We thought it would be fitting to bring our space chimp home and let him chill. Whether you have a long mission behind you or a full afternoon ahead, this session IPA will help keep things real. More relaxed than an IPA, but with all the hop aroma and flavor, Down to Earth is our tribute to unsung heroes and unplanned adventures. 
Down to Earth is available year-round in six-pack cans and on draft and pairs nicely with a variety of things, including lunch.
name: Down To Earth

description: Escape the mundane with this Citra-based, Session IPA, the perfect beer to end a workday or to carry you through a weekend with friends. A heavy dry-hop and pristine finish make Drift the ideal indulgence for any time, every time. Serve cold and enjoy with friends.
name: Drift

description: Our session IPA is truly that - a beer brewed with the express intent of enjoying several pints of Driftwood in a sitting and still feeling ready to attack a night out. We use as much late addition hops as in our normal IPA to maintain IPA levels of aroma and flavor while toning down the bitterness to allow for a balanced and drinkable beer. Hopped with Mosaic and Citra, Driftwood expresses bright notes of citrus, passion fruit, mango, and pineapple. This undoubted Wolf's Ridge employee favorite is sure to be one of yours, too.
name: Driftwood

description: Easy Beaver is brewed just in time for the Spring and Summer seasons; designed to keep you refreshed and loaded with hops all day long. Every batch of Easy Beaver will feature a different strain of hops to showcase the varietal’s flavors and aromas. Crisp, clean, and aromatic, this session brew is bound to make you kick your feet up and smile.
name: Easy Beaver

description: Easy Glider is the perfect beer for the days when you just want to relax with your friends and family. Our Session IPA couples the flavors and aromas of an American IPA with a lower alcohol content. Pronounced citrus, tropical fruit and floral aromas from the three hop varieties pair with a notably crisp malt body. Showcasing the unique hybrid, Equinox, this India Pale Ale embodies bold, complex character.
name: Easy Glider

description: Straw colored brewed with a hint of wheat and crystal malts, hopped with Palisade & Cascade Hops. Easy going so you can enjoy more with this great Session IPA. Easy Goer Session IPA just in time to make the summer easy going.
name: Easy Goer

description: Brewmaster Matt Brynildson went to the mountain and returned with a vision for a different kind of Session IPA, one that would be brewed and dry hopped with a globetrotting selection of new hop varieties from Europe, New Zealand and North America. He foresaw a beer that would deliver massive hop aromas, a signature malt balance and an empty glass before you knew what hit you. And so the newest member of our Jack IPA family was born.
name: Easy Jack

description: Easy Livin' is an IPA that you can enjoy glass after glass. It has a huge nose with aromas of tropical fruit and pine. The mouthfeel is light and refreshing. Whether or not you are relaxing on the porch or by the fire, Easy Livin' IPA makes a fine companion.
name: Easy Livin' IPA

description: Our take on a sessionable IPA, this light-bodied ale packs a ton of flavor and aroma from the Sorachi Ace and Centennial dry-hopping. It’s the one IPA to have when you’re having more than one!
name: Easy On The Eyes

description: The only thing “effortless” about this beer is how it drinks. Domestic and imported malts take a backseat to the loads of American grown hops that are dumped into the kettle. Dry-hopped for mouthwatering aroma with Mosaic and Palisade hops, and infused with natural grapefruit flavor to add to the refreshment. Enjoy an Effortless drinking experience with our Grapefruit Session IPA.
name: Effortless Grapefruit IPA

description: The hit of a heavily hopped IPA, with the sessionability of a classic UK pale ale. Simcoe and Centennial hops dominate this light blonde beer, contributing a big tangerine aroma and long,quenching citrus pith flavour which goes on and on and on.
name: Eternal

description:
Bright and sunny. Two words that come to my mind when I think of my four year old daughter, Evelyn. These same two words rang through my ears when presented with the chance to provide you with my artistic output. Hardywood Evelyn Session IPA has been built specially for hot days and beautiful sunshine. Bright as I could make her, and singing with tropical juicy fruit notes, Evelyn pours across the palate dry and crisp allowing you to keep going all day. Weighing in at 4.9% and begging to keep playing, I proudly present to you, Evelyn session IPA. Drink deep, friends!  - Kevin Storm, Brewer
About the artist:
Mike Baker is a self taught artist in Richmond, VA. His work ranges from traditional tattoo flash to macabre and painterly ink wash portraits. See more on instagram @mikerbake.
name: Evelyn

description: Evolving Hare session IPA  features a rotating hop that changes with the season. Evolving Hare is super drinkable IPA with a 4.6% ABV and a featured hop that will roatate throughout the year.
name: Evolving Hare

description:
Tasting Notes:
Nose: Citrus and straw.
Palate: West coast hop flavours greet the palate. Primarily grapefruit and gooseberry, with a mild grass and spice note from the Amarillo hops. Light yet present malt tastes move in behind. The beer finishes crisp and dry, with a very mild training bitterness.
Other Notes:
First off this beer is not a traditional IPA, so those expecting a huge nit of bitterness will be disappointed. Session IPAs are lighter bodied and lighter in alcohol than a normal American IPA. Hop, and bitterness is used in beer to balance the alcohol. In a beer with a lower abv, the IBU must be lower as well in order for the beer to maintain its balance. In a session IPA very little bittering hop is used. Hops are added very late in the brewing process to create a strong aroma and flavour profile. This style is intended to a hop forward light beer, something that is well suited to the patio and hot weather. The session in the name refers to this style being a beer that one could consume in larger amounts due to the lower alcohol content.
name: EXHIBITION SESSION IPA

description: A Session IPA, "Factory Girl" uses 3 varieties of Australian hops and Parkway's house yeast strain. The flavor is all hops up front with a light body and notes of tropical fruit, apricot and citrus. Finishing with a fading bitterness and slight malt/cereal notes, this light, refreshing seasonal is a perfect summer companion.
name: Factory Girl

description: Our seasonal Fall Harvest Ale is brewed with a generous amount of Columbus, Cascade, and Millennium hops lending a nice drinkable bitterness. We then add our mix of fall spices to give hints of apple, cinnamon, and nutmeg. This beer bridges the end of Summer IPA season and the beginning of Autumn spiciness.
name: Fall Harvest Ale

description: Hoppy and refreshing, this tasty summer release is the perfect accompaniment while having fun in the Florida sun!
name: Float On Session IPA

description: Folly’s Pride - 4.7% abv Crisp, clean, citrusy. Grapefruit Blonde. Summer Session Ale. Easy drinking with mild acidity. Ingredients: Organic malted barley, organic grapefruit zest, organic hops, house ale yeast. Folly’s Pride post Folly’s Pride, our summer session ale, aka grapefruit blonde, is out on the market and getting a tremendous response. We love this beer, made with 10 lbs of fresh organic grapefruit zest. There was an article in the City Paper about our collaboration with the Juice Joint to make the beer. Re-selling the grapefruits to an organic juicer was the only way we could make this work, so we did it! Look for Folly’s Pride to be available all summer as a seasonal through September.
name: Folly Pride

description: Session ale / Luncheon ale. 3.7%  A sneaky little number offering some easy drinking light relief from all those hop bombers. Ideal for those who like to spin a yarn over some time or have expensive / dangerous machinery to operate after lunch.
name: FOXY TALE

description: Since Day One, we've been abundantly forthright and fully transparent about our lust for hops. It's led us to craft many an IPA, most of them imperial—some intense for their time and all timeless in their intensity. For Stone Go To IPA, we are embracing our hop obsession in a new way, funneling an abundance of lupulin-borne bitterness into a "session" IPA delivering all the fruity, piney character of a much bigger IPA. To accomplish this, we employed "hop bursting," a new technique wherein an irrational amount of hops is added during the final phase of the brewing process to coax out extreme flavors and aromas while also imparting a burst of desirably pleasant bitterness. The result is an Alpha-acid-rich beer that fans can enjoy more of without missing out on the assertive hop character you, like us, crave. So, sit back and go two with your new everyday go-to IPA and bask along with us in the glory of the almighty hop.
name: Go To IPA

description: Overly hopped session IPA with Cascade, Belma and Columbus hops.
name: Good Guy Session IPA

description: A Pale Ale with a dry, toffee-nutty flavour and notes of citrus and pine due to generous helpings of English and American hops.
name: Good Ordinary Pale Ale

description:
Forget everything you knew about the previous version of our Greed.
This new installment is a ‘Session IPA’ meaning it is a light, low-alcohol
IPA, very refreshing and easy to drink more than one. It pours a golden
color with a creamy beige head. It is unfiltered so it is slightly cloudy.
The aroma is fresh and hoppy. It delivers the traditional grapefruit hop
flavor of an IPA.
name: Greed

description: A light bodied pale ale showcasing the aromatics of our Pacific Northwest hop blend.
name: Green Street

description:
Our Session IPA is brewed with leisure in mind. Whether you are making the turn or watching the game with old friends, it’s the perfect complement to an easygoing lifestyle.

Notes of citrus and pine exist in perfect balance with its malt profile and the low ABV allows you to enjoy even the longest of afternoons. It’s brewed with 2-Row and Victory Malts, a generous helping of hops during the boil, then dry hopped for one week before kegging and canning. This IPA deserves a day off.
name: Greenskeeper

description: A medium-bodied India Pale Ale with spicy notes of rye and a bright hop aroma
name: Haleakala Sunryes

description: A sessionable-ish IPA made with 100% Nelson Sauvin hops. This beer is 100% whirlpool w/ strong flavors and aromatics of Sauvignon Blanc wine and fresh mangos.
name: Half Nelson

description:
Introducing our newest canned beer, the first in Kentucky to be available in 12-packs, the Half-Bite IPA!half-bitelogo-01
“Designed to be the younger brother of the West Sixth IPA, the Half-Bite IPA uses the same varieties and quantity of hops as our regular IPA, but contains only half the alcohol – so it’s perfect for summer days and outdoor adventures when you want to have a few”, said one of our co-founders Brady Barlow.

Reflecting on the nature of the beer, it only seemed appropriate the Half-Bite IPA will be canned and sold in 12-pack boxes. We’re really excited to be the first brewery in Kentucky to do this.

It’s aggressively hopped with Centennial, Citra and Columbus hops and packs a great bite, earthy bitterness and citrus notes but clocks in at only 3.5% ABV.
name: Half-Bite IPA

description: Cooling out on the dock, jamming tunes and popping tops, wait for da rod to bend. Gist of the grist is mellow at 4.2%, laying down the base to showcase the blazin’ Amarillo hop hash sunset.
name: Hash Session IPA

description: Created to have all the hoppy goodness of an IPA, but brewed to a sessionable strength.  Its intense fruit-salad character comes from generous additions of US West Coast hops.  A full bodied and fruity beer, with notes of passion fruit, grapefruit, gooseberry, pineapple & mango.
name: Heart & Soul

description: Can you say Ham-ven-tion? Over? Hamvention is almost as synonymous to Dayton as those two guys and that historic airplane invention we’ve heard so much about. Home Brew Radio Session IPA was brewed in honor of the loyal “Hamventioneers” who come to our fair city each year to celebrate everything Amateur Radio has to offer. Home Brew Radio Session IPA has a lot to say about flavor! Right up front you’ll be squarely hit with beautiful fresh citrusy hops followed by a nice bitter bite…no static at all! Consider your palette cleansed. This bright gold IPA pairs well with just about any food, is a real thirst quencher and is highly sessionable at 4.5% ABV. Home Brew Radio Session IPA… May your signal always be clear!
name: Home Brew Radio Session IPA

description: Brewed for our hardworking musician friends from The Jordan Years.
name: Homemade Hustler

description: Blood Orange Gypsy.
name: Hop Continuum No. 1

description: End of the day. Work’s done. Fun’s in session. Make it last with this aromatic ale brewed to keep the good times going. A session IPA full of Azacca™ and Sorachi Ace™ hops, with all the flavor you’ve come to expect from Foothills. Thirsty? Get a Job.
name: Hop Job

description: A trio of hops come together in this crisp session IPA. Brewed with Meyer lemon, Hop Slice balances floral hop notes and a subtle citrus kick.
name: Hop Slice

description:
So, you like hops. You really like hops. You dream about hops. You obsess about hops. You want to marry hops. Sounds like a classic case of Hopochondria, which is probably why you're attracted to this beer.

Our session IPA is perfect for those who really dig the complexities of an IPA and want something more accessible. With five unique hop varieties, it boasts citrus, floral, and grassy notes. So go ahead and pop the top. Rest assured, it isn't all in your head.
name: Hopochondria

description:
Hoppy Diver is a Session IPA that was inspired by a trip to the hop harvest in Yakima, Washington. Imagine yourself surrounded by mountains of hops, with an aroma so enticing you feel like diving in and rolling around in all that delicious piney, danky goodness. Well that is what our Head Brewer Brannon Radicke did…he dove right in! On the trip to the hop harvest, we got a chance to try a new experimental hop that has yet to be named. It’s just numbered hop #07270. We were intrigued and just had to try it. Thus our Session IPA was born.

Hoppy Diver Session IPA was brewed with only two-row pale malt and the experimental #07270 and Mosaic. Full of herbal and citrusy notes, Hoppy Diver has all the hop flavor you’d want from an IPA but with a lower ABV. So pull a seat at the bar, and enjoy this limited-release beer on draft, and imagine yourself in a mountain of hops!
name: Hoppy Diver

description: Brewed with Vienna and Munich malts. Hopped aggressively with Mosaic, Simcoe, and Amarillo.
name: How Easy it is to Deny the Pain of Someone Else's Suffering

description: Using all locally grown and produced ingredients, we set out to make a Pale Ale that is exemplary of the great malt, hops and water Idaho has to offer. Lightly hopped, you will find lemony citrus and herbal notes highlighting this very quaffable beer.
name: Idaho Session Ale

description: All the strength and sting of an IPA in a low-alcohol package. Barely tipping the scales at just below 4% ABV, this little beer can be enjoyed all day long - if you can handle the bitterness!
name: Inaugural Session IPA

description: Opinionated and hopped-up, Introvert can easily be misunderstood for having a strong personality. But this artistically complex IPA seeks balance and creative harmony with low ABV and a relaxed pace. Explore Your Introvert, gather your closest friends and explore the possibilities. Hop aromas of tropical papaya and kiwi with woodsy pine, balanced by honey malt and a clean bitter finish.
name: Introvert Session IPA

description: Una versión suave de una IPA , suave en alcohol , agradable de beber pero bien lupulada , es una cerveza en la que predomina absolutamente el lúpulo sobre la malta. Tiene un bonito tono amarillo-anaranjado con cierta turbidez , aromáticamente es muy compleja predominando frutas tropicales y toque pináceo , tiene un cuerpo ligero , muy fácil de beber y sabores frescos de los lúpulos.
name: IPA-NEMA

description: Inspired by 24 hours of daylight, Kicker Session IPA is an anytime brew with fruity Citra and Amarillo hops and a burst of bright citrus Simcoe hop aroma.
name: Kicker Session IPA

description: Built in 1797, the USS Constitution is a heavy frigate that was made for war. During the war of 1812, she captured multiple merchant ships and destroyed five British warships earning her the nickname “Old Ironsides”. This brew was created to stand the test of time like the ship it was named after. Deceivingly smooth with just enough bite, this brew is built to win not only wars built, but also the hearts and minds of the public. Come enjoy a day on the open seas with a companion that is made for anything you can throw at it.
name: Legendary American Spirit

description: Brewed for the warm, stunning, long days of summer in the Pacific NW, Life Jacket Session IPA will refresh and quench your thirst like no other. Concocted with Pale ale and Pilsner malts, producing a light golden hue and providing a crisp, clean and dry malt base for the Yakima Valley grown Amarillo and Nugget hops to emerge from. Abundant late hop additions in the kettle, whirlpool and fermenter contribute powerful hop notes of citrus and tangerine in the flavor and aroma, while bitterness remains muted. Whether you’re mowing the lawn, weeding the garden, hiking the mountains, or enjoying the water, stay cool and safe with a few Life Jackets
name: Life Jacket Session IPA

description: An American-style IPA brewed to “sessionable” strength. Passionfruit and grapefruit dominate the flavor profile, while the clean Irish malt keeps to the backround, creating an intense, yet balanced hop-forward beer.
name: Little Fawn

description: LongerDays is a Session IPA, named after some friends of ours and brewed for people like us – those who want to enjoy a few beers throughout the longer days of summer, without missing the sunset.  Although it is lower in alcohol, LongerDays sacrifices nothing in flavor.
name: LongerDays Session IPA

description: A wheat based session IPA with a crisp, silk malt body that balances resiny hop bitterness and boasts loads of tropical fruit flavor on the finish. Simply crushable.
name: Lost Galaxy

description: Kelly Ryan has returned for the third time to brew for us, this time at Shepherd Neame Brewery (Kent), where he is re-creating this excellent beer for the second time. This golden beer is a lower-strength IPA, bursting with fruit notes, while the biscuity, smooth mouthfeel is balanced by a clean bitterness. Hops: Citra, Nelson Sauvin, Simcoe
name: Low Blow

description: The beat is steady and clear. First it’s in your fingers, snap-snapping. Then it’s in your toes, tap-tapping. The rhythm rises free and flowing. A new session finds its pace and tunes out time, leading you on a remarkable journey. Slake it with song, feed it with feeling and let Low Key be your guide.
name: Low Key

description: The Low Pressure Session IPA sits at a comfortable 5.2% and the mango-citrus flavors make this an ideal beer for any daylong hangout.
name: Low Pressure

description: A light bodied hop bursted session IPA that focuses on  showcasing the piney, resiny, and tropical fruit notes of Mosaic hops. It pours a clear golden color with aromas and flavors of passion fruit and pine.  The hop bitterness is balanced making it very easy to drink.
name: Lowball Session IPA

description: A light yet complex IPA that can be enjoyed all day. Chinook and Eldorado hops bolster the aroma and flavor.
name: Lucky 27 - Session IPA

description: She’s a fair Maiden, but a heartbreaker. She wraps us in her deep golden glow, teasing us with crisp citrus scents, whispering secrets of fragrant hops from faraway lands. So we draw her to our lips. And just like that, she’s gone. Ah, well. One Maiden calls for another.
name: Maiden

description: A clean and crisp session ale noting a smooth hop bitterness balanced with our premium malts, then dry hopped to create a truly “sensational session” IPA.
name: Main Street Session IPA

description: American hop breeders have led the way in creating unique and interesting aroma varieties. Hop breeders across the globe have followed suit. Beer II in our Hop Program, a session IPA, features some of our favorite aromas varieties from here and abroad- Amarillo, Citra, Simcoe, Hallertau Blanc and Nelson Sauvin.
name: Maine Beer II

description: A session IPA with mango puree and natural mango flavors, pink peppercorns and dry-hopped with Australian Galaxy Hops.
name: Man-Go-Crazy IPA

description: Our Summer Seasonal IPA is made with a blend of Cranberry and Lemon and has a bright citrus hop character.
name: Marie Celeste

description: Peer pressure got the best of us this time. After repeatedly being asked to brew a session IPA, we finally caved in. So in true Device fashion, we hopped the daylights out of it and hit it with the Basilica dry hop schedule for an intense aromatic experience.
name: Me Too!

description: We used all Apollo hops. The high aroma hop usage resulted in a very vegital flavor; you could literally taste the hops.
name: Misdemeanor First

description: This time we used Apollo hops for bittering and flavor and bravo hops for aroma. This resulted in a less vegetal hop flavor while enhancing the hop aroma.
name: Misdemeanor Second

description: We used Apollo hops only for bittering and then Bravo for flavor and aroma.
name: Misdemeanor Third

description: A “session” IPA (only in IPA standards). This IPA is done with 100% mosaic hops which gives it a very tropical-fruit aroma and flavor.
name: Mosaic Marathon

description:
Our Coastal Reserve series is a hoppy playground for our brewers to experiment and push boundaries.

So when the Mosaic hop first came on the scene, they couldn’t wait to get their hands on some. Mosaic Session Ale is bursting with vibrant grapefruit aroma and flavors of citrus and tropical fruit. Our signature dry-hopping technique delivers an incredibly drinkable, lower ABV beer; without sacrificing hop appeal. From a small test batch to the bottle you now hold in your hands, this isn’t a one-and-done beer. Sit back, have a few, and enjoy your session
name: Mosaic Session Ale

description: Our "Session IPA" bursts open with aromatics of fresh citrus fruits, ripened melon and a distinctive floral bouquet. Weaved carefully under the hop bitterness lies a light, semi-sweet malt body, that finishes in a crisp N' clean fashion.
name: No Problems

description: This 2015 GABF Bronze Medal winner in the Session IPA category is pale golden in color, light-bodied and the ultimate treat for your nose with big hoppy aromas and flavors reminiscent of pink Nerds, white Airheads and melted Big Sticks. 4.4% abv
name: Nose Candy

description: Session IPA made for the Mrs Double D event held at Slide Bar.
name: Nuclear Chi Chi's

description: To be totally honest, it wasn’t really part of our plans to brew a collaboration beer with Cigar City also this year. But we received a mail from head brewer Wayne Wambles saying: "Hey guys, I’m coming back for the Copenhagen Beer Celebration, why don’t we brew a beer?" And since Wayne is not only one of the nicest persons in the craft beer world but also one of the most innovative and skilled, it was an easy decision to make room in our schedule for another Cigar City collaboration. The beer of choice turned out to be "Orange Crush" a so called Session IPA - low in alcohol and potency, but high in drinkability. Heavily dry-hopped with the juiciest of American aroma hops: Citra, Mosaic and Simcoe and a solid dose of our secret ingredient, a super fragrant brand of American orange peel. Orange Crush is a bit of a quaffer - we’re almost certain, that you will like it. And Wayne….you’re welcome back anytime!
name: Orange Crush

description: Straight from our stash to your glass, we've created a chronically crushable ale that turns over easy without exhausting the palate.
name: Over Easy Session IPA

description: We created Philadelphia Runner’s Ale to commemorate The Philly 10K on September 6th. The 6.2 mile race runs through the heart of the city starting on East Passyunk Avenue. The race winds through a dozen Philly neighborhoods past row homes, markets and restaurants. Philadelphia Runner’s Ale is a 4.5% session IPA that will be available on draft only at the Post Race Street Festival on East Passyunk and at participating bars and restaurants. A research study conducted by Dr. Manuel J Castillo, Professor of Medical Physiology School of Medicine at the University of Grenada discovered that beer has positive re hydration effects after physical exertion. It has become a tradition here in Philadelphia for some running clubs to enjoy a beer at the end of a run by toasting “To the professor!”. We hope you will toast the professor while enjoying our latest creation.
name: Philadelphia Runner's Ale

description: How do you cram as much hop & malt flavor and aroma as possible into a beer but make it crushable too? That’s the challenge we answered with PINNER Throwback IPA. This drinkable IPA uses several varieties of hops to target the ever-evolving flavor. With tropical fruits, citrus juices, pineapple and spice berry up front in the aroma and flavor, the biscuit & toasted bread at the back balance out all the hops and make a great finish to go on to your next can of PINNER. It’s the perfect beer for a little sip, sip, give.
name: Pinner Throwback IPA

description: A sessionable IPA brewed with a single malt and hopped up with Citra, Amarillo and Simcoe hops. Easy drinking with a burst of citrusy hops.
name: Pipehawk Mountain Ale

description: Made for the Gothenburg hamburger restaurant burgersson.
name: Poppels Fatserie 003 the burgersson edition

description:
SESSION IPA 
Ölen du håller i din hand är en Session IPA. Namnet kommer sannolikt från England och tiden då arbetarna faktiskt fick dricka under sina "sessions". För att saker inte skulle gå helt överstyr krävdes ett lättare öl på mellan tre och fyra procent. Vår tolkning är något starkare och passar utmärkt efter men inte på jobbet. 

"En utmaning när man arbetar med alkoholsvaga öl är att få till kropp och munkänsla. Det finns alltid en risk att ölet kan upplevas vattnigt. Här har jag använt fem olika maltsorter, tre humlesorter och slutligen, för att hedra ölets ursprung, en klassisk alejäst från England. 
- Daniel Granath, bryggmästare
name: Poppels Session IPA

description: Named after our friends down this street, this IPA is lacking in alcohol but not flavor, with a lovely hop finish and mild body.
name: Practice Yoga

description: Bursting with ripe citrus and tropical fruit hop aromatics, this Belgian IPA is refreshingly dry and super drinkable with a crisp, clean bready malt character and lively Belgian yeast notes.
name: Promiscuou's Apostrophe

description: This easy-drinking hopped-up session IPA may be light in color but is packed full of lemony herbal notes and subtle strawberry flavors derived from Lemondrop and Azacca hops.  Expect a dry, crisp finish that will leave you wanting another…and another.
name: Rainbow Road

description: A light and Floral Session IPA Hopped with Simcoe, Citra and Summit form boil to dry hop. With a crisp clean malt profile that show cases all the hop flavors and aromas
name: Relaxer

description: Straw-colored beer hops in which the Anglo-Americans, with citrus notes and dry aftertaste, blend harmoniously with the elegant Belgian spiciness and a light refreshing acidity. Excellent as an aperitif and as a fire extinguisher for your thirst!
name: Riff

description: From the brewery: "Rye Felicia is brewed with a 40 percent blend of rye. Giving the spicy and roasty flavors. A mixture of English and New Zealand makes this unique fall on the IPA side of things while it retains its brown rye awesomeness."
name: Rye Felicia

description:
Freshly squeezed apricot on the nose contradicts the full-flavored, hop-forward palate with bright carbonation followed by a lingering, spicy bitterness on the finish.

Sandi’s signature: Nugget and Chinook hops for bittering, Equinox for dry hopping. Roasted barley and pilsner malts and lots of spicy rye.
name: Rye IPA

description: Easy drinking "Session" ale. Light on the malt, but still heavy on the hops.
name: Sargon

description:
Tons of late addition hops including Simcoe and Chinook. Easy drinking, moderately bitter, with a huge pine forest aroma and flavor.
"Get learn-ed" by the Schoolmaster!
name: Schoolmaster Session Hoppy Ale

description: Segal Ranch Session IPA features Tomahawk, Centennial and Cascade hops that were hand-selected by our Brewmaster exclusively from our friends at Segal Ranch in Yakima, Washington. The verdant pungency and citrus aromatics from Tomahawk hops serve as the perfect base layer to allow the flavors of bright floral and pine sap from Centennial hops to emerge on the palate. Notes of resinous citrus from Segal Ranch’s high-oil Cascade hops shine through the finish.
name: Segal Ranch Session IPA

description: Bright grapefruit aromas transition to candied lemon and mandarin oranges under a full-flavored yet dry, tart finish.
name: Session Brett IPA

description: At a lower ABV, this India Pale Ale is designed to be enjoyed by all. This recipe is highlighted by a hop bill including nuggets, cascades, ahtanum, and sorachi ace. It has subtle malt character which is enhanced by a heavy hop profile that leaves a lingering bitter finish.
name: SESSION IPA

description: Pairs best with spicy foods.
name: Session IPA

description: All the hop flavor and bitterness you love at a respectable ABV.
name: Session IPA

description: Our Session IPA flaunts bold citrus flavors with floral undertones and is perfectly balanced by a smooth malt character. This is one IPA that won’t knock you off your bar stool.
name: Session IPA

description: We made it! And to commemorate our one year anniversary we brewed this amazing session IPA. Mashed with Pale malt, Munich malt, and a respectable amount of Flaked Oats and Flaked Wheat. This session sits at 4.9% a.b.v. and is packed with so much hop flavor it's hard to believe it only has 50 IBU's. If you couldn't tell just by tasting it, we used very specific amounts of Chinook, Centennial, Citra and Mosaic hops. This is a one off beer and will not be produced again...or until we can find more Citra and Mosaic hops. Let us know if you have some and drink it while it lasts. Cheers!
name: Session IPA

description: Light golden in color and pours with a dense white head. This beer showcases an abundant tropical fruit and citrus hop aroma due to an intense dry hopping schedule using copious amounts of American hops. A balanced malt profile rounds out these accentuated hoppy flavors and light bitterness to finish with a clean, hop bursted presence. Light in body, low inalcohol and BIG in flavor make this a true session beer!
name: Session IPA

description: The Cuban Missile Crisis, the Space Race, Baseball’s Homerun Race of ’98. Let’s face it, Americans are no stranger to an arms race. Enter, craft beer. Breweries everywhere are dumping hops in by the pound and ramping up alcohol content, leaving dedicated hophead tailgaters with few choices for responsible drinking. We bring you the session-style India Pale Ale. Session-style means moderate alcohol content. This is your chance to enjoy a full flavor, aggressively hopped IPA – without melting your face off. Handcrafted with Cascade and Magnum hops, this IPA is influenced by IPA City, USA (San Diego) and perfected for tailgaters around the world. Grab this bouquet of liquid hopped glory and enjoy full flavored drinking, not sipping. (AKA Sorta IPA - 4.7% ABV, 44 IBU)
name: Session IPA (Sorta IPA)

description: A Pale malt base with a touch of Vienna and Oat malts provide a smooth breadiness to the bold citrus flavor and aroma. Amarillo and Citra hops for both boil and dry-hop additions bring out the classic IPA punch, while the low gravity allows for multiple pints.
name: Sessions in the Abyss

description: The Short Hop is a completely NEW recipe that shines a light on the hop character of an IPA but weighs in at only 5.2%. Short Hop has a nice round body with a fruity and slightly resinous hop forward character. We have added a variety of malts to create a fuller body as well as a hint of rye for complexity. Light in color with a dry, clean hop finish should make you come back for more, and the lower ABV makes it possible.
name: Short Hop
Sit and Stay India Session Belgian Ale

description: Canned beer offering coming Spring 2016 to Mad Anthony Brewing Company
name: Six to Midnight

description: This India Session Ale is a duel hop beer showcasing Mosaic and Citra hops. Brewed with pale and pilsner malts, it’s light bodied and golden in color. Perfect to quench your summer thirst!
name: Skin N Bones

description: Sly Boogie Session IPA is fresh, crisp and citrusy with a balanced hoppy finish that will make your palate boogie down! Everything that you love about an India Pale Ale and you can have more than one! It's sly and that's no boogie!
name: Sly Boogie

description:
An exceptionally satisfying and full bodied beer for its stature, with the same big hop hit you may have come to expect from our more muscular Pale Ales. This beer is vibrant with citrus, melon and sherbet flavours meandering to gentle bitter finish.

Malts: Pale, Munich, CaraGold, Crystal, (Barley) Wheat, Oats. 

Hops: Target, Bramling Cross, Hull Melon, Columbus.

Yeast:Safale US-05.
name: Small Beer No. 9

description: The 4th beer in our single hop Session IPA series, Hops-Huell Melon or Mandarina Bavaria.
name: Small Crop #4

description: Inspired by our small-batch pilot system, the Roots Release series honors our experimental brewing roots and invites you to sample some of our favorites. This full-flavored Session IPA splices together tropical fruit aromas with bold, fresh citrusy hops. The result is an easy drinking, balanced IPA; one you’ll reach for again and again.
name: Splice Session IPA

description: This first of a series of rotating dry hop editions in this satisfyingly hoppy, drinkable session IPA.
name: Spring + Summer Session IPA Nelson Sauvin

description:
Can’t wait for Spring to get here? Crack open a Spring Fever Session Ale and before you know it, those winter frowns will be turned upside down!
Spring Fever delivers the flavor and impact of an American IPA with the session-ability of a light beer. Catch the fever before it’s gone!
name: Spring Fever Session IPA

description: Steady Rollin' Session IPA is inspired by the lush, vibrant landscape of the Great Lakes region, our all-hours, year-round outdoor playground. Steady Rollin's tropical fruit flavors, balance, and light body make it a perfect companion for cutting a new trail or rowing to a secluded bank with friends to kick back and watch the afternoon fade away. Steady Rollin' is brewed for those days when you can only guess what time it is based on where the sun sits in the sky.
name: Steady Rollin' Session IPA

description:
Out of the 90’s Pacific Northwest music scene, Suicide Squeeze Records founder David Dickenson forged his own path with acts like Modest Mouse, Elliott Smith, and Pedro the Lion, forgoing standard industry protocal. Similarly, Fort George has chosen to craft beer that is often outside the beer style guidelines. This year’s spring collaboration with Suicide Squeeze Records is one of those beers – a crisp session IPA with every bit of the hoppy flavor and aroma you’ve come to expect from Fort George. Floral and citrusy, Suicide Squeeze IPA is a light ode to spring.

VISIT SUICIDESQUEEZE.NET/FORTGEORGE TO DOWNLOAD A FREE MUSIC SAMPLER
name: Suicide Squeeze IPA

description: Sundial, a sessionable IPA at only 4.5% ABV, is Community Beer Co.’s newest seasonal release.  When you want hops and a refreshing, crisp beer that’s drinkable all day long, Sundial is the answer.  We keep the grist simple to showcase our delicious hops, and use copious amounts of Centennial, Simcoe and Amarillo hops to give a delightful hoppy aroma and flavor.  Hop bitterness is present, but dialed back with just enough to balance the malt and contribute to the refreshing nature of our new favorite summer beer!
name: Sundial Session IPA

description: Our hoppy, refreshing session drinker. This bright golden colored brew offers aromas of tropical fruit and pine, along with juicy, citrusy blast on your palate. Finishes with a lingering dry bitterness. Peace, Love & Hoppiness!
name: Sunshine Daydream Session Ale

description:
Super Session is designed to be a light and refreshing beer with low alcohol, yet the full hop character of a Session IPA. Go ahead, you can have more than one… Cheers!
KEEP COLD – DRINK FRESH!
name: Super Session IPA

description:
Super Session #2 is designed to be a light and refreshing beer with low alcohol, yet the full hop character of a Session IPA. Go ahead, you can have more than one… Cheers!
KEEP COLD – DRINK FRESH!
name: Super Session IPA #2

description: A hazy summer session IPA with a refreshing citrus hop flavor made for easy drinking on warm summer days. At 4.8% ABV, you can have a couple and still get the lawn mowed.
name: Tail Lights

description: The State of Texas is now in the full possession of a beer fitting for the quality of her People. Brewed with superb Texas grown malt and American hops. Purely for the leisurely day time enjoyment that the People deserve.
name: Texas Sucession IPA

description: The little brother to our flagship DRIPA, this lower-alcohol, sessionable IPA features the same bright citrus intensity in the aroma with a lighter mouthfeel and a classic dry finish. If you like big hoppy flavors, but want to last all day, you need The Fluffer. “Can't get enough of that wonderful Fluff!”
name: The Fluffer

description: A sessionable India Pale Ale brewed with unmalted rye; the spicy malt bill supports an array of intense hop aromatics, all engendered by a classic Pacific Northwest hop bill; brewed with Cascade, Simcoe & Amarillo hops, then heavily dry-hopped with Simcoe & Amarillo.
name: The Imposter

description: Session IPA with Nelson and Citra hops.
name: Time Bomb

description: The heat is on. You just finished a long run in the sun. Or, you're sitting on your porch in the cool of the evening seeking respite from summer. Or, you're celebrating the Fourth with family and friends and you desire a smooth, cold, flavorful beverage that won't put you flat on your back (not yet, anyway). Enter Outer Light Brewing Company's Trail Magic IPA. Light and crisp, it tickles the tongue with flavors reminiscent of black tea, melon, and fruit. Sessionable and refreshing, this easy-drinking ale will satisfy your summer cravings. Don't get caught trailing behind. Try our latest magical offering.
name: Trail Magic Session IPA

description: This brew climbs the branches of your palate to a floral hop bouquet of citrus flavor and aroma. Golden Promise Pale malts mingle with three hop varietals: earthly yet fruity bitterness of Simcoe, Mosaic's herbal grab bag of flavor, and the tropical aromas of Equinox.
name: Treerider IPA

description: Mountains of hops allow tropical fruit aromas to intertwine with an undertone of melon, fruit and slight citrus in our IPA offering.
name: Trhopical Illusion IPA

description: Our take on an ever-evolving classic. Good deep malt undercurrent is shaken by a slowly surging citrus wave. Lemon and sherbet notes fade to leave a refreshing, lingering bitterness.
name: Unicorn IPA

description: Brewer Gabe Smoley’s Unchained 21: Us & Them is a truly unique craft beer exploration. Gabe has deconstructed the mash of Summit's popular Sága IPA recipe into two unique “threads” to forge two distinct beers: a hoppy and intense American IPA and a complex, but subtle Session IPA. This unique brewing experience explores the two extreme flavor profiles and drinking differences you can discover in one package from one, original beer recipe. Which beer do you think is “Us” and which beer is “Them”? Which brew defines you? Offered in 6 packs that include three bottles of each brew. Also available on draught.
name: Us & Them IPA - Unchained 21

description: Brewed with oats, spelt, and rye. Hopped with a copious amount of Mosaic hops. This beer is undeniably crushable.
name: Virgins & Diamonds

description: A sessionable pale/blonde ale.
name: Walden

description: There are a bunch of great waves here on the central coast, and we love chasing them down. We also love wrangling in our favorite hops, like the heaps of Amarillo & Citra we used to make this super sessionable IPA. The low alcohol won’t hold you down while hop bursting brings on flavorful bliss.
name: Wave Wrangler

description: Ways & Means is a session IPA brewed with rye and just the right amount of Citra and Centennial hops for pleasing bitterness. It boasts complex aromatics of citrus and tropical fruits, finishing with the typical clean, refreshing character for which our beers are known. The very first keg of this beer was served in the United States Capitol to members of the U.S. Congress Ways & Means committee. Both Democrats and Republicans found that it was a beer that all could agree upon.
name: Ways & Means

description: We let the clean flavor of a lager collide with the classic hops of an IPA. It’s obsessionable. So have another.
name: West O Holy L

description: All the juicy hop flavor you crave with less of the intoxicating qualities of it’s big brother.  What I’m Having is generously dry hopped with Amarillo and Citra for a citrusy, tropical hop flavor.
name: What I'm Having

description: Our flagship beer, this bright and delicious session IPA has an ABV of 4.3% and showcases the flavors and aromas of Simcoe, Amarillo, and Citra hops. The hop additions for this beer all occur post-boil--in the whirlpool, hopback, and fermentor--giving this beer a big, dank aroma but preserving its light body. The grain bill is simple: the majority being floor-malted two-row pale malt with a touch of dextrin malt and crystal malt (30° L).
name: Whetstoner

description: Not your traditional IPA, this is a wheat based beer fermented with a hefeweizen yeast giving it a hazy gold appearance with a Belgian feel. Plenty of hops are added early in the boil to give it that IPA bitterness, while the Citra and Amarillo hops add a fruity, citrus aroma.
name: White IPA
